verses.text: 這流人血的城，有禍了！全城欺詐，充滿劫掠；搶奪的事總不止息。

words.note: Often refers to bloodshed or murder in biblical context.
Implies endlessness or persistence.

verses.text: 鞭聲颼颼，輪聲轔轔，駿馬奔馳，戰車顛簸跳動。

words.note: Onomatopoeic, describing wind or whipping sounds.
Onomatopoeic, describing heavy rolling sounds.

verses.heading: Portrayal of the Destruction of Nineveh

verses.text: 騎兵騰躍衝鋒；刀劍爍爍發亮，槍矛閃閃生光；被殺的人眾多，死屍成堆；屍體無數，眾人都被屍體絆倒。

words.note: Literally 'rush the front'.
Often used reduplicatively to describe shining.
Often used reduplicatively to describe sparkling.

verses.text: 都因妓女多有淫行，施邪術的美麗女巫，藉著她的淫行誘惑列國，藉著她的邪術欺騙萬族。

words.note: Often used metaphorically for idolatry or spiritual unfaithfulness in the Bible.
Refers to sexual immorality, or metaphorically, spiritual idolatry.
Refers to witchcraft or black magic.
Refers to the Gentile nations in biblical context.
Implies all tribes/ethnic groups of the world.

verses.heading: Taunt against the Harlot City

verses.text: 萬軍之耶和華說：看哪！我必攻擊你；我要把你的裙子掀到你的臉上，使萬國看見你赤身露體，使列邦看見你的羞恥。

words.note: Part of a divine title, often 'Lord of Hosts'.
Classical Chinese equivalent of '的'.
Common biblical exclamation, draws attention.
Introduces object of a disposal construction.
Verb with directional/resultative complement.
Emphasizes complete nakedness and exposure.
Similar to 列國, referring to different peoples or nations.

verses.text: 我要把污穢可憎之物拋在你身上，侮辱你，使你成為眾人觀看的對象。

words.note: Classical Chinese possessive/linking particle

verses.text: 看見你的都必逃避你，說：「尼尼微荒涼了；有誰為她悲哀呢？」我在哪裡可以找到安慰你的人呢？
你比挪亞們還強嗎？挪亞們位於尼羅河流域，周圍有水環繞；海是她的屏障，水作她的牆垣。

words.note: Unusual rendering of 'No-amon' (Thebes in Egypt), with '們' typically a plural marker for people.
Unusual rendering of 'No-amon' (Thebes in Egypt), with '們' typically a plural marker for people.

verses.heading: Nineveh Will Suffer the Same Fate as Thebes

verses.text: 古實和埃及，是她無窮的力量，弗人和路比族，是她的（按照《馬索拉文本》，「她的」作「你的」;現參照《七十士譯本》翻譯）助手。
然而她卻被遷徙，被擄去了；她的嬰孩在各街頭被摔死；人們為她的尊貴人抽籤。她所有的達官貴人都被鎖鍊捆著。
至於你，你必喝醉，必被隱藏；你必因仇敵的緣故，尋找避難所。

words.note: Lit. 'place to avoid disaster'

verses.text: 你一切堡壘，如同無花果樹上初熟的果子，若被搖撼，就必落在想吃的人口中。

words.note: Lit. 'flowerless fruit tree'

verses.heading: The Assyrian Defenses Will Fail

verses.text: 看哪！在你裡面的人都是婦女，你境內的門戶，都向仇敵敞開；你的門閂被火燒毀。

words.note: Commonly used in Bible translations as an interjection.

verses.text: 你要打水，以備圍困，鞏固你的堡壘，踹泥踏土，緊握磚模。

words.note: Refers to mixing clay for brick-making.
Often paired with 踹泥 for making construction materials.

verses.text: 在那裡火要燒滅你，刀劍要除滅你，吞吃你，好像吞吃蚱蜢一樣，你只管增多如蚱蜢，加添像蝗蟲，
你增加了你的商人，多過天上的星辰。蚱蜢退了殼，就飛去了。

words.note: More poetic/literary than '星星'.

verses.heading: The Assyrian Defenders Will Flee

verses.text: 你的領袖多如蝗蟲，你的軍長像一群群的螞蚱；天涼的時候，停留在籬笆上；太陽一出，就都飛走了；沒有人知道牠們在甚麼地方。

words.note: Reduplication of '群' emphasizes 'many groups'.
Synonym of 蚱蜢.

verses.text: 亞述王啊！你的牧人睡覺，你的貴族安歇，你的子民分散在各山上，沒有人招聚他們。

words.note: Repetition for emphasis in address.
More formal/literary than 休息.
Often refers to people under a ruler's governance.
More formal/religious than 聚集.

verses.heading: Concluding Dirge

verses.text: 你的創傷無法醫治；你受的打擊非常嚴重。聽見你這消息的，都必向你鼓掌；因為你不斷行惡，誰沒有受過害呢？

words.note: Refers to a severe or deep wound.
Forms a nominal phrase, e.g., 'those who hear...'
